SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

org.eclipse.gef4.geometry.shapes
Class Ellipse

java.lang.Object
  org.eclipse.gef4.geometry.shapes.Ellipse
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Geometry
public class Ellipse
extends Object
implements Geometry

Represents the geometric shape of an ellipse, which is defined by means of its enclosing framing rectangle. Note that while all manipulations (e.g. within shrink, expand) within this class are based on double precision, all comparisons (e.g. within contains, intersects, equals, etc.) are based on a limited precision (with an accuracy defined within PrecisionUtils) to compensate for rounding effects.

See Also:
Serialized Form

equals

public boolean equals(double x,
                      double y,
                      double width,
                      double height)
Tests whether this Ellipse and the ellipse defined by the given bounds are equal.

Parameters:
x - the x-coordinate of the bounds defining define the ellipse to test
y - the y-coordinate of the bounds defining the ellipse to test
width - the width of the bounds defining the ellipse to test
height - the height of the bounds defining the ellipse to test
Returns:
true if this Ellipse and the ellipse defined via the given bounds are (imprecisely) regarded to be equal, false otherwise

equals

public boolean equals(Object o)
Tests whether this Ellipse is equal to the given Object.

Overrides:
equals in class Object
Returns:
true if the given Object is an Ellipse, which is (imprecisely) equal to this Ellipse, i.e. whose bounds are (imprecisely) equal to this Ellipse's bounds

intersects

public boolean intersects(Line l)

Parameters:
l - The Line to test for intersection.
Returns:
true in case this Ellipse and the given Line share at least one common point, false otherwise

intersects

public boolean intersects(Rectangle r)
Description copied from interface: Geometry
Returns true if the input Rectangle intersects this Geometry, i.e. there is at least one common point. This includes the case that the given rectangle is fully contained.

Specified by:
intersects in interface Geometry
Parameters:
r - The Rectangle for the intersection test
Returns:
true if the input Rectangle and this Geometry have at least one common point.

Initializes this Ellipse by means of the given bounds values.

width - the new width of this Ellipse, which is the width of its bounds
height - the new height of this Ellipse, which is the height of its bounds

toPath

public Path toPath()
Returns a path representation of this Ellipse, which is an approximation of the four segments by means of cubic Bezier curves.

Returns:
A new Path representation for this Geometry.

getBorderSegments

public CubicCurve[] getBorderSegments()
Calculates the border segments of this Ellipse. The border-segments are approximated by CubicCurves. These curves are generated as in the toPath() method.

Returns:
border-segments
